contentrichtext.text: {{otheruses}} [[Image:brick-terms-1.jpg|thumb|250px|right|]]A '''wythe''' is a continuous vertical section of [[masonry]] one unit in thickness. A wythe may be independent of, or interlocked with, the adjoining wythe(s). A single wythe of [[brick]] that is not structural in nature is referred to as a veneer. A multiple-wythe masonry wall may be composed of a single type of masonry unit layered to increase its thickness and structural strength, or different masonry units chosen by function, such as an economical concrete block serving a structural purpose and a more expensive brick chosen for its appearance. ==References== {{reflist}} {{cite web | last = Weber | first = Richard A. | title = Building Envelope Design Guide - Masonry Wall Systems | publisher = [[National Institute of Building Sciences]] | url = http://www.wbdg.org/design/env_wall_masonry.php | accessdate = 24 October 2011}} [[Category:Masonry]]
